frame.name: Partitive
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Subset</fen> is profiled against the <fen>Group</fen> it belongs to. The <fen>Subset</fen> may consist of a single member. Frequently, the <fen>Group</fen> is actually a generic sample of a full population, and the <fen>Subset</fen> is representative of the relative proportion.
<ex><t>Of</t> <fex name="Group">all scenes that evoke rural England</fex>, <fex name="Subset">this</fex> is one of the loveliest.</ex>
<ex> As of 5:30 p.m. Moscow time, <fex name="Subset">23</fex> <t>out</t> <t>of</t> <fex name="Group">46 miners stranded in the Zapadnaya-Kapitalnaya mine</fex> have been rescued</ex>
<ex><fex name="Subset">1.5</fex> <t>out</t> <t>of</t> <fex name="Group">10 respondents</fex> preferred Shrub over Ferry</ex>
</def-root>
